alert.note: Alert for Buffalo; Dawson; Greeley; Howard; Nance; Sherman; Valley (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 01 at 3:18AM CST until January 03 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Heavy mixed precipitation possible. Total ice accumulation up to one quarter of an inch possible. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches expected, with amounts as high as 6 inches possible. North winds could gust as high as 40 mph Monday night through Tuesday. * WHERE...The highest potential for heavy snow and ice accumulation is north and west of a line from Kearney to Fullerton. * WHEN...Best chances for ice accumulation will be late tonight through the day on Monday. Best chances for accumulating snow will be Monday night through Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Power outages and tree damage are possible from ice accumulation. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Travel disruptions will likely extend south of the Winter Storm Watch area as well. At least light ice accumulation is possible over most of the area. Even light icing can lead to difficult travel conditions.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

area.areaDesc: Buffalo; Dawson; Greeley; Howard; Nance; Sherman; Valley
